Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad observation and categorization of image elements to gather clues.
Meta-level exploration of output format, considering how to represent the location.
Shallow comparison of two naming options (Praed Street vs Paddington).
Further divergent weighing of address vs neighborhood formatting choices.
Continued broad comparison between street and neighborhood options.
Jump back to an alternative choice (Praed Street) based on example matching.
Ongoing exploration of core requirements, comparing two possibilities.
Divergent deliberation over granularity (street vs neighborhood).
Shallow elimination and selection of street address to match example format.
Broad review and confirmation of street-level output choice.
Re-weighing of street vs neighborhood representation (divergent reconsideration).
Re-evaluation of instruction examples and format consistency.
Revisiting prompt requirements and example formats to guide output choice.

Depth-First.Explanation: Identified key image clues and began targeted cross-referencing of known routes and stations.
Depth-First.KeyElement: GWR Class 800 train and Victorian-era station architecture

Depth-First.Explanation: Focused analysis on the trainâ€™s name and station features to narrow down candidates.
Confirmed match of train identity and unique roof design to London Paddington.
Systematic synthesis and verification of all visual clues leading to final location.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Combined GWR train identity and Brunel station architecture

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: After broad clue gathering, reasoning converges on verifying specific hypotheses.
Upon confirming the location, analysis shifts from verification to divergent output formatting.
Model returns from format exploration to detailed synthesis and evidence verification.
